title: Minion Dematerializer rune in the Inspiration tree needs a buff.

embed.description: Start the game with 6 Minion Dematerializers that kill and absorb lane minions instantly. Minion Dematerializers are on cooldown for the first 155s of the game. Absorbing a minion increases your damage by +4% against that type of minion permanently, and an extra +1% for each additional minion of that type absorbed.

body:
Currently there is no reason to take Minion Dematerializer over Magical Footwear and Future's market. The % damage increase is not significant enough to out weight free boots at 10 minutes that are gold efficient.

**Problem:**
Each Dematerializer used shouldn't have diminishing values if used on the same time. Currently, the first proc on one minion type increases damage by 4% and procs after only increase damage output by 1%.

**Suggestion:**
Keep each proc consecutive and consistent in terms of damage out put. Lower the % to 3 but all procs after remain at 3%.
This would be a helpful start, increasing the number of dematerializers doesn't seem to be the right course of action (currently start with 6) because they already take up a much needed item slot.

Thoughts?

replies.body: We agree that this rune isn't really living up to what we wanted for it, and is kinda letting the slot down. No timeline on improvements, but we are exploring where to go with it.
In my opinion the resistance section of resolve is also using up rune slots that could have been used for more interesting ones.
So true... Conditioning seems like the best one by far.

i'm not here to voice my opinions, but to ask a genuine question

what exactly was minion de-matierializer meant to be used for originally

was it to not miss cannon minions?

was it for a AoE mages to wave clear without leaving the melee minions with a sliver of hp?
{{champion:412}}  + {{item:3302}}

Pretty sure it's meant for melee champs when playing against ranged champs that can pressure off of csing. The main example I thought of was Ekko, as he has some pretty hard matchups and also really wants to push the wave. The problem is that the % increase is so low it's not noticeable, and it's not available level 1, which is when these champs need it most.

Some other options could be fizz, or any melee playing against teemo, but these don't necessarily benefit from the increased damage. 

Honestly I'm thinking about it and AT BEST you use this to last hit 6 minions you would have otherwise missed ... that's 150 gold. Why not just take the strictly better futures market?

I could imagine that rune like that would be rather meant for splitpushing builds on tanks (likely combined with demolish). Killing enemy cannon minions takes forever for a tank, ability to smite them combined with bonus damage could aid pushing power greatly.

But in it's current shape, the rune is just too weak to be of any worth. Maybe if it transformed the minion into allied one instead of killing it, or if killed minions exploded with some AoE damage it would be more worth it.

I believe it is meant for players with very high game knowledge of certain champions. For example, lux's E will almost always leave casters with a sliver of HP unless you're quite fed. This means lux has to over extend to last hit them. Having 5% bonus damage to casters will eliminate that risk, which is pretty significant. I'm sure there are more champions like that, I'm just not as familiar with them.

In the old system, some champions (example: Ekko, Ahri or Talon) used to run very specific to hit certain waveclear thresholds. Minion dematerializer was meant to allow them to waveclear as well as before

Could see it being useful for {{champion:45}}, in order to get Q stacking easy and fast. The faster you can get to greasing minions from full/near full off cooldown, the higher those numbers are going to go.

Suggestion: make it instant. Right now there's a delay between when you initiate minion dematerializer and when the minion dematerializes. This makes things like using the minion dematerializer to remove a minion and then quickly using blitzcrank's Q to pull an enemy before they have time to reposition infeasible. The moment the enemy sees the minion dematerializer animation, they re-position to be behind another minion and you can't Q them.
I was really disappointed in the way it actually works.

How about something like this?

Your autoattacks against enemy minions deal 5% of minion max health damage when enemy minion has under 50% health until 15 minutes into the game.

Reasoning: 
If runes purpose is to make last hitting easier for champions that it is hard (because lack of ad or because slow AA animation) this would be great choice without it leading to other problems like overpowered split-pushing power. %max health would also take into account the fact that minions health goes up as the game progresses and it would be easy for player to predict how much damage he actually does to minions.

- Why only when minion has under 50% health? Because taking this to champions that have great wave clear early would result too much push power, the same reason is that this rune should be tied to autoattack only. The rune should help player last hit, not push the wave ultra fast under tower.

- Why disable it in 15 minutes? I believe it would result in too much split push power for attack speed based split pushers. Tied to 15 minutes prevents this.

This is just a thought but I would happily hear your opinion about this.
